title: Diana's build path
body: Excluding the games where you need a zonya or abyssal, why do people get nashors before rabadon? I've tried both, numerous times. Especially with thunderlords, all you need is a large rod -> rabadon and you can qrwb >50% hp, then do it once more. It's safer than trying to basic attack all day.

replies.body:
I'd say CDR and attack speed of which it provides a lot of both.

It gives you a fallback pattern other than "hit Q - R - R". Diana does have great assassination potential, but some players like myself would prefer to strengthen the lulls in her fighting pattern rather than all in on having to delete a squishy and dying, which also requires hitting a skillshot on a medium cooldown.
Her passive scales greatly with {{item:3115}}, usually you would see it on Jungle Diana but i guess Top/Mid could work.

I'd say, the 80ap is gr8. Last hitting minions plus the bonus ~25 on hit dmg.

Besides if you get rabidly second you have a greater ap boost, in the sense that the %30 feels more valuable going off the (120+80)*1.3 

(yes it's the same if you get rab first, I'm not some pancake 12 yearly)

As Gehirn said.

Though I prefer to get some heavy AP first such as a Ludens, but now thanks to Runic Echos I can't get Ludens anymore.
I guess I'd now go Runic into Lich, that'll give a fair amount of AP with move speed, CDR and increase to the mana pool.

I like Nashor's Tooth, and I'll use it a fair bit on Diana, but I don't really like it that much on her.
Thankfully though Diana is a highly versatile champion that can have a large variety of builds. Different items compliment her kit in different ways.

Oh and as Essembie said, Rabadon's first isn't that great, early game you'll get the same amount of burst from Diana with a Ludens/Runic/Hourglass/Nashor as you do from Rabadon's but the other items will give you more utility stats making them more valuable early game.
For Rabadon's most champions should aim for it roughly mid to late game, possibly the only exception here would be Veigar who can get a Chalice/Tear first back then rush a Rabadon's and figure his build out from there.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Farm? Push? 3rd attack reset? Rabadons scales with ap and not best first item because scale benefit comes mid / late?

Those are my thoughts as to why.
